runs.comm: around the wicket, flicked to short long leg, no chance of a single
wider and it spins down the leg side actually, gripped that
touch short and a back foot drive through cover, too wide a line also, not a great nut at all
back on line and Amla back and across works to deep midwicket
length on off stump, punched to cover
fuller and driven this time to cover where Jordan makes a diving save
straight line and tucked to square leg
good length at the stumps, tucked to square leg shuffling back in the crease
touch short and flicked into the stands over square leg, that is fantastic, the bat speed to whip that over the leg side, great timing too
length at the thigh pad, Amla misses with a flick to leg
full on the stumps, too straight, and this is flicked over square leg off the front foot this time, only for four but again the timing was impeccable
sliding into the pads again but this slides down leg
full at middle stump, Amla tries to work to leg but pats it down the wicket
touch shorter length and Amla plays back to the bowler again
de Kock back in his crease and works wide of mid-off for a single
gives himself room and flicks from off stump backward of point, gets it in-between the two fielders in there, excellent wrist work
down the track, tries to swing to leg, there's a hint of turn and he gets it off inside edge and pad to short long leg
down the wicket, misses and Buttler misses the stumping sitter really, straight to him, simply dropped it, easy stumping chance
next ball he comes down again and whips this over wide long-on, lovely stroke, that's what he was trying the previous ball
more air, went for the sweep and missed, it pitched outside leg
length ball on off stump, patted up the wicket from the crease
short and pulled in controlled fashion to the square leg sweeper
Amla across his stumps and tucks a length ball through square leg for an easy single
full on the stumps, firm drive to mid-off
shot, hint of width to work with, de Kock stays leg side of it and carves it backward of poin
straighter line and whipped wide of long leg but Jordan scrambles very well to save two
back of a length and wide, that was there to be hit and de Kock mistimed it to cover
straighter line on a similar length, pulled hard but straight to the deep square leg

Amla goes across his stumps for the scoop and misses, it balloons off the pad to Buttler who shies at the stumps, Amla was back and there didn't appear to be any bat on that for the caught behind appeal
lovely strike down the ground, not perfect timing but hit through the line to a length ball and enough to carry it into the rope
slower ball, Amla stepped to leg that time and adjusted well to pull to deep square leg
short leg side but again de Kock finds the fielder with a strong pull, this reaches long leg
full on leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
good length just outside off, Amla steps to leg and aims a wild whoosh at it and misses
touch short, Amla waits in the crease for it and heaves it wide of long-on, one bounce four
full on off stump, driven to extra cover and they steal a sharp single
well down leg, Buttler dived to take it nicely to his right
length ball at the body, dropped into square leg for an easy run
full, Amla meets it on the full in fact and guides it to point where there's a half save but it runs away for a couple
around the wicket, full on middle and leg, worked into midwicket for an easy run
Amla across his stumps, flicking backward of square leg for another easy run
slides on as de Kock tries to sweep and gets struck on the pad
waited for, rocked back and cut hard backward of point, lovely stroke, touch short delivery
paddle swept and Dernbach at short long leg rather dives over it and concedes a couple
slower, more air, forward just blocking is de Kock
full on the stumps, whipped out to deep midwicket
short around off stump and pulled without timing to mid-on
another pull, not timed again but this is forced through midwicket for an easy single
full on the leg stump, flicked out backward of square but Lumb slides and saves to good effect
fourth-stump line, Amla tries to swing from the crease but only finds the bowler
poor ball, short and wide and cut over point, nicely put away that
length on the off stump, flicked through square leg
leg stump, quite full, flicked firmly past midwicket but just a single to the deep fielder
full and de Kock tries to sweep and misses
down the wicket and worked through square leg, just a single again
nice drive with a wristy flick wide of deep cover so they get a couple
Amla forward punching down to long-on and that is his first fifty in a T20 for South Africa, nice time to break that bad run
length on off stump, punched out to deep cover, good work from Bresnan, it's just a single
low full toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
back of the hand slower ball outside off, Amla swings and misses but Buttler totally misses it and it runs under his legs for four byes!
length that takes the thigh pad to short long leg, the hurry a run
full length just outside off, driven out to deep cover
another slower ball outside off, too wide outside off, Amla swings and misses
goes to turn this to leg and gets a huge leading edge that loops down the ground but lands safe, very lucky and they get back for two
low full toss just outside off, the drive finds deep cover
short, hammered into deep midwicket, it's short of the fielder, Hales takes it on the bounce
waited for in the crease and carved out to deep cover with the ball sliding across him
swung into midwicket, it's a mishit that runs wide of long-on and they can get back for a couple

swung over the leg side again but this time picks out deep midwicket and Amla falls having provided his side with a lovely start. He tried to clear the front leg to swing a short ball just outside off over the leg side but the connection wasn't great and he found Hales
full at the off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
full at the middle stump, played forward into midwicket for a single
around the wicket, just outside off stump, carved without timing wide of point for a single
full on the stumps, a pleasant drive down to long-on
slower ball, de Kock meets it on the full and drives wide of deep cover who, running to his right, can't save two
full length just outside off, whipped down to long-off
touch short but only slapped to deep cover
around the wicket, plenty of flight, de Villiers down the ground only slaps it to long-off for one

down the wicket, de Kock runs straight past it and this time Buttler completes the stumping with a sharp piece of work but that was equally as straightforward as the Amla chance. Tredwell did de Kock in the flight really, who came out of his ground and got nowhere near the pitch of the ball, tried to steer it into the leg side but missed
flight with a slip in, pushed down to long-off on the front foot
flatter ball, de Villiers steps to leg and guides this through point, excellent placement and gets four, top batting
down the wicket and hammered straight as a dye, no chance for the deep straight fielders, excellent timing from AB
this time stays in the crease and pushes firmly to long-on
length ball outside off, slapped towards mid-off where the diving Tredwell can only parry it partially and it runs away for four, poor work in the field again from England
full and wide, de Villiers slips driving out to deep cover
length ball, driven to point where Moeen dives and saves very smartly
length ball, slapped hard but straight to extra cover
short and swatted past mid-on, Jordan running around from midwicket uses the boot but does save four
full and wide, de Villiers reaches for it and can only toe-end it back to the bowler
full but just down leg, Duminy was going for the scoop and missed
full just outside off, Duminy drives hard but only to mid-on, both straight men up in the circle here
short and Duminy gets hit on the hip missing with a pull, it runs behind the wicket and Buttler dives and parries well, could have run for four that

short and pulled into midwicket, Duminy didn't time this, it looped into the deep but short of Bopara but he gathers and throws at the striker's end and Duminy is having to dive to get back for the second - with no bat! - and is run out comfortably. For once England smart in the outfield, that was good work from Bopara, danger man gone
six men up in the circle, full at the stumps, driven to point
man goes out to deep point, Jordan goes short and Miller is hurried trying to pull and gets it off the splice of the bat up the wicket
short again and this is pulled again, this time more successfully out to deep midwicket
step to leg, this doesn't get up as Miller was expecting and he misses with a pull and the ball goes past leg stump
legnth on leg stump tucked down to long leg
slower ball on the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler who wears it on the chest and almost grabs the rebound, might be hurt here Bresnan, think it was actually the wrist where he was hit
short of a length, a short-arm jab out to deep square leg
more short stuff, pulled wide of deep square but Jordan scrambles very nice to keep it just to a single
full and outside off stump, de Villiers carves it over backward point, good time for a boundary and ruins what would have been a superb over
full on leg stump, strikes the pad and they get a leg bye into midwicket
sliced drive over cover that fortunately for de Villiers lands wide of deep cover, Lumb slipped in fielding but managed to save four
short sliding down leg and pulled wide of long leg, poor ball really
full outside off, de Villiers was reaching for it and got a toe end that rolls slowly to mid-off for a sharp single
short again to Miller but again he can't time it, gets it off the splice to deep square leg
short once more but de Villiers can deal with it, hooking through deep square leg, another important boundary, makes that an excellent over for South Africa
full just outside off stump and with mid-off up that is a disgusting delivery, timed really nicely over the fielder, excellent timing, nearly carried for six
full toss on leg stump, slogged over the leg side and wide of long-on, Dernbach misses the yorker again gets punished
oh dear, leg side wide now, nine of two balls, is the old Dernbach returning?
short now and at the leg stump, flicked down the leg side and Buttler almost snaffles a superb catch at full stretch, saved four anyway, it just brushed the glove on the way through
full and driven out to deep cover, just wide of the fielder and de Villiers is lightning quick and gets back for two
slower ball, a mighty hack to leg misses and I think took a toe-end along the ground to the keeper, the umpire didn't hear the snick and called wide
full and de Villiers is outside off stump down one knee hammering it straight down the ground and all the way for six, what a shot that is
oh Jade, a beamer outside off, this over has undone England's good work
slower ball, de Villiers sets himself and smashes it over long-on, that's AB's fifty and the fastest in T20s for South Africa
full and wide outside off stump, swung and missed and called wide! That is pretty  harsh
full toss on the stumps and whacked over midwicket, there's Miller's power, fifty stand in just 26 balls now
excellent yorker that just misses off stump with Miller aiming leg side with a swing
full outside off and a swing and a miss and this ins't called wide, rightly
similar delivery, swung towards long-on and not timed well enough and Moeen takes the catch straight to him and he took it at waist height. Simply not enough willow on the stroke from Miller
full on leg stump, de Villiers is right down and manages to play a reverse paddle sweep and gets enough bat on it to steer it away past short third man, incredible shot
full outside off, de Villiers across to it and slashes it past point
short and swung hard to leg, Jordan does very well on the deep midwicket fence coming to his left to field
full wide of off stump, reached for and gets it off the toe to cover
de Villiers across his stumps and flicks a full delivery which he meets on the full over midwicket, another outrageous stroke
slower ball and pulled into the deep, straight to Moeen and he drops it! And worse still it runs into the fence! I think Moeen lost it in the floodlights
a swing outside off and it takes the bottom edge into his boot
full just outside off, Morkel tries to swing to the leg side and gets a thick inside edge into his stumps so nothing off the last ball, Morkel swinging a bit too hard
